page.title: 12LOCAL HOUSING
page.content:
Homes on the ridges and along the edges of the moor are clustered in tiny groups. Houses have spread upwards from the valley floor as new homes have been built.
Many old{barns}and{farmhouses}have been converted into fine houses, as have the back-to-back{cottages}of the mill workers from the 19th century.
New housing developments are being built as the area gains in popularity. Since the older houses are built of the local greyish{stone,}the new houses are built to conform, but frequently make use of reconstructed stone.
{Roofs}are tiled in slate.
